comments.body:
@doncat If given two items with two barcodes that are under the same holding and the same size category, should only one AbID be added as an 852, or should a second 852 be generated? If only one, then which one? The first one or the second one?

Edit: Or is it, like the last two examples in the document, that only one AbID should be generated? What happens if there's already an AbID in Alma? Don't generate anything?

Only one AbID, per MARC structure.  You're looking for distinct values of holdings records, as in the last two examples.
Already an AbID:  Hmm.  That might represent a workflow detour!  Uh, hmm.  Uh.  I don't think it's supposed to happen because the cataloger knows the item is an added volume.  But nonetheless, if you detect an existing AbID, don't generate a new one but do include the barcode in the file you return to us.  We need it for label printing (if we can get SpineOMatic configured).
Does "detect" an existing AbID make sense?  I'm now asking you to check for a pattern in 852h, instead of just identifying the holdings record.

bibdata.title: Recap materials from partners institutions should include "Remote Storage" in the location label.

comments.body:
Tested on bibdata_staging and catalog-qa. 
The scsb location is being retrieved from bibdata directly.
If bibdata has no entries then it falls back to the solr_document, holdings_1display field (same as the rest of the pul records.)

The difference between SCSB location display and pul location display is that for the second we use javascript to get the availability through the availability.json and if JS is not working then it falls back to bibdata; if bibdata is nil then it falls back to the indexed solr_document.

![Screen Shot 2021-08-20 at 12 05 42 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9905193/130262077-ff7af37a-4b53-401e-ae4e-e41033748ca6.png)

![Screen Shot 2021-08-20 at 12 05 25 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9905193/130262088-24e71077-02ce-4088-8a57-9e0d48acc2b2.png)
